Gabriel is brazilian, 21 years old, studies Computer Science at the university of São Paulo and is currently enrolled on a six-month mobility program at USI. 

 Before enrolling on his bachelors in Computer Science, Gabriel unfortunately started studying Computer Engineering in the same university. He transferred after the second year of engineering. 

 Some of Gabriel's hobbies are: watching Musical theater, Movies and participating in Programming Competitions, such as ICPC. 

 Gabriel does not play any musical instruments besides the flute, although sometimes he tries to play the guitar. 

 His favorite dish is Chicken Stroganoff (the brazilian one, with rice instead of pasta). 

 Gabriel likes to listen to a lot of brazilian rock, rap, brazilian typical music, international pop and even, who would have thought, musical theater soundtracks. 

 Link to Gabriel's github: github.com/gafeol.

Pedro Almeida was born and raised in Cubatão, a small city in São Paulo state. He moved to São Paulo (the state's capital) when he was 19 to start his undergraduate studies at Universidade de São Paulo - one of the most prestigious universities in the whole Latin America. He is taking the Computer Science bachelor program, with emphasis in Artificial Inteligence and e-Science, currently he is abroad as an exchange student at Universita della Svizzera Italiana. 

 The things that fascinates Pedro are those that are paradigm- breaking, ground-breaking, useful and that adds some sort of content to his person. He's very passionate about art, music, linguistics, literature and technoloy. His favorite hobbies are learning new languages, listenning to new music and feeling them as an experience. He also enjoys building new things - and he feels very fulfilled making things that would help people. 

 One of his dreams are to cross the whole Americas (south, center and north) by car. And other aim of him is to build something that would transform the world in somewhere less unequal. 

 Finally, he is very happy and proud to be in Lugano and he hopes that that experience helps him achieve his main objectives in life. 

 Link to Pedro's github: www.github.com/robonauta.
